text.section: There is a Joint Committee on Fair Practices and State Personnel Oversight.

section.section: The Joint Committee consists of eight members.

Of the eight members:
four shall be members of the Senate, appointed by the President of the Senate; and
four shall be members of the House of Delegates, appointed by the Speaker of the House.

text.section: The members of the Joint Committee serve at the pleasure of the presiding officer who appointed them.
The President and the Speaker jointly shall appoint a Senator and a Delegate to serve as cochairs.

The Joint Committee shall have oversight over:
employment policies and personnel systems in the Executive Branch of State government, including:
the State Personnel Management System;
the Maryland Department of Transportation's Human Resources Management System; and
the personnel systems of State institutions of higher education;
matters in State government of equal employment opportunity policies and practices; and
procurement practices made under executive order.

The purposes of the Joint Committee are to:
review reports;
evaluate the effectiveness of programs, policies, and practices; and
identify areas of concern and, as appropriate, recommend corrective measures to the Governor and the General Assembly.
